00016 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00017  * File:    hcomp.h
00018  * Purpose: header file for compression information & structures
00019  * Dependencies: should be included after hdf.h
00020  * Invokes:
00021  * Contents:
00022  * Structure definitions: comp_info
00023  * Constant definitions: lots...
00024  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00025 
00026 /* avoid re-inclusion */
00027 #ifndef __HCOMP_H
00028 #define __HCOMP_H
00029 
00030 /* For determining which type of modeling is being done */
00031 typedef enum
00032   {
00033       COMP_MODEL_STDIO = 0      /* for Standard C I/O model */
00034   }
00035 comp_model_t;
00036 
00037 /* For determining which type of encoding is being done */
00038 typedef enum
00039   {
00040       COMP_CODE_NONE = 0,       /* don't encode at all, just store */
00041       COMP_CODE_RLE,            /* for simple RLE encoding */
00042       COMP_CODE_NBIT,           /* for N-bit encoding */
00043       COMP_CODE_SKPHUFF,        /* for Skipping huffman encoding */
00044       COMP_CODE_DEFLATE,        /* for gzip 'deflate' encoding */
00045       COMP_CODE_SZIP,       /* for szip encoding */
00046       COMP_CODE_INVALID,        /* invalid last code, for range checking */
00047       COMP_CODE_JPEG            /* _Ugly_ hack to allow JPEG images to be created with GRsetcompress */
00048   }
00049 comp_coder_t;
00050 
00051 /* Compression types available */
00052 #define COMP_NONE       0
00053 #define COMP_JPEG       2
00054 #define COMP_RLE        11
00055 #define COMP_IMCOMP     12
00056 
00057 /* Compression encoder/decoder configuration */
00058 #define COMP_DECODER_ENABLED     1
00059 #define COMP_ENCODER_ENABLED     2
00060 
00061 #ifndef COMPRESS_MASTER
00062 extern uint16 compress_map[];
00063 #else
00064 uint16      compress_map[COMP_MAX_COMP + 1] =
00065 {                               /* Mapping from compression types to tags */
00066     0,                          /* No corresponding tag for un-compressed data */
00067     0,                          /* (1) */
00068     DFTAG_JPEG5,                /* COMP_JPEG -> DFTAG_JPEG5 (for JPEG compression) */
00069     0,                          /* (3) */
00070     0,                          /* (4) */
00071     0,                          /* (5) */
00072     0,                          /* (6) */
00073     0,                          /* (7) */
00074     0,                          /* (8) */
00075     0,                          /* (9) */
00076     0,                          /* (10) */
00077     DFTAG_RLE,                  /* COMP_RLE -> DFTAG_RLE (for Run-length compression) */
00078     DFTAG_IMC                   /* COMP_IMCOMP -> DFTAG_IMC (for IMCOMP compression) */
00079 };
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 typedef union tag_model_info
00083   {                             /* Union to contain modeling information */
00084       struct
00085         {
00086             int32       nt;     /* number type */
00087             intn        ndim;   /* number of dimensions */
00088             int32      *dims;   /* array of dimensions */
00089         }
00090       dim;
00091   }
00092 model_info;
00093 
00094 typedef union tag_comp_info
00095   {                             /* Union to contain compression information */
00096       struct
00097         {   /* Struct to contain information about how to compress */
00098             /* or decompress a JPEG encoded 24-bit image */
00099             intn    quality;    /* Quality factor for JPEG compression, should be from */
00100             /* 0 (terrible) to 100 (very good) */
00101             intn    force_baseline;     /* If force_baseline is set to TRUE then */
00102             /* quantization tables are limited to */
00103             /* 0..255 for JPEG baseline compability */
00104             /* This is only an issue for quality */
00105             /* settings below 24 */
00106         }
00107       jpeg;
00108       struct
00109         {   /* struct to contain information about how to compress */
00110             /* or decompress a N-bit encoded dataset */
00111             int32   nt;     /* number type of the data to encode */
00112             intn    sign_ext;   /* whether to sign extend or not */
00113             intn    fill_one;   /* whether to fill with 1's or 0's */
00114             intn    start_bit;  /* offset of the start bit in the data */
00115             intn    bit_len;    /* number of bits to store */
00116         }
00117       nbit;
00118       struct
00119         {   /* struct to contain info about how to compress */
00120             /* or decompress a "skipping" huffman encoded dataset */
00121             intn    skp_size;   /* size of the individual elements when skipping */
00122         }
00123       skphuff;
00124       struct
00125         {   /* struct to contain info about how to compress */
00126             /* or decompress a gzip encoded dataset */
00127             intn    level;   /* how hard to work when compressing the data */
00128         }
00129       deflate;
00130       struct
00131         {
00132             int32 options_mask;   /* IN */
00133             int32 pixels_per_block;   /* IN */
00134             int32 pixels_per_scanline; /* OUT: computed */
00135         int32 bits_per_pixel; /* OUT: size of NT */
00136             int32 pixels; /* OUT: size of dataset or chunk */
00137          }
00138        szip;  /* for szip encoding */
00139 
00140   }
00141 comp_info;
00142 
00143 #endif /* __HCOMP_H */
00144
